results_summary: Huperzine A showed cognitive enhancement at 0.4 mg in clinical trials, with improvements in memory function tests (MMSE, ADAS-COG). It was well tolerated at doses up to 0.4 mg for 24 weeks, though animal studies indicated mild to moderate cholinergic side effects.
population_specificity: Patients with Alzheimer's disease (specific demographics not detailed).
effective_dosage: 0.2 mg and 0.4 mg (only 0.4 mg showed efficacy).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the neuroprotective effects of Huperzine A on synaptic deficits and its potential mechanisms in APPswe/PS1dE9 transgenic mice, focusing on amyloidogenic and nonamyloidogenic APP processing pathways.
results_summary: Chronic Huperzine A treatment significantly improved dendritic spine density and synaptotagmin levels, reduced amyloid plaque burden and oligomeric Aβ levels, and modulated ADAM10 and BACE1 expression in APPswe/PS1dE9 mice, suggesting neuroprotective effects via APP processing regulation.
population_specificity: APPswe/PS1dE9 transgenic mice (a model for Alzheimer's disease).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the safety, tolerability, and efficacy of Huperzine A in treating mild to moderate Alzheimer's disease, comparing two dosages to placebo.
results_summary: Huperzine A 200 μg BID showed no cognitive benefit, while 400 μg BID demonstrated a modest improvement in ADAS-Cog at 11 weeks but not at 16 weeks. No significant effects were observed on clinical global impression, neuropsychiatric symptoms, or daily living activities at either dose.
population_specificity: 210 individuals with mild to moderate Alzheimer's disease.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether Huperzine A has immunomodulatory properties and potential therapeutic benefits in treating experimental autoimmune encephalomyelitis (EAE), a model of multiple sclerosis.
results_summary: Huperzine A significantly reduced neurological severity, decreased inflammatory cell accumulation, demyelination, and axonal injury in EAE mice, while modulating pro- and anti-inflammatory cytokine levels and inhibiting T-cell proliferation.
population_specificity: Murine model (mice with experimental autoimmune encephalomyelitis)
interactions: Mecamylamine (nicotinic acetylcholinergic receptor antagonist) reversed HupA's inhibition of T-cell proliferation.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate new mechanisms by which Huperzine A activates Wnt signaling and reduces amyloidosis in Alzheimer's disease (AD) brain.
results_summary: Huperzine A increased ADAM10, decreased BACE1 and APP695 protein levels, and reduced Aβ levels and burden in mouse brain, suggesting enhanced nonamyloidogenic APP cleavage. It also inhibited GSK3α/β activity and increased β-catenin levels, indicating neuroprotective effects via Wnt/β-catenin signaling.
population_specificity: β-amyloid (Aβ) precursor protein and presenilin-1 double-transgenic mice.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether Huperzine A could enhance cognitive performance in normal young adult monkeys performing visual memory tasks of varying difficulty.
results_summary: Huperzine A did not significantly improve performance in monkeys performing optimally but showed improvement in poorly performing subjects (55-69% accuracy). It reduced accuracy when baseline performance was near maximum (90%).
population_specificity: Young adult pigtail macaques (Macaca nemestrina)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the binding interactions of Huperzine A and galanthamine with the acetylcholinesterase enzyme to understand their inhibitory effects.
results_summary: Huperzine A showed stronger binding interactions with acetylcholinesterase than galanthamine, primarily due to hydrogen bond formation and hydrogen π interactions with specific residues (Trp84 and Tyr130). The binding energy of Huperzine A was significantly higher (-28.4 kcal·mol(-1)) compared to galanthamine (-17.0 kcal·mol(-1)), suggesting more potent inhibition.
population_specificity: Not specified (in silico study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if coadministration of Huperzine A and ligustrazine phosphate could improve memory deficits and reduce cholinergic impairment and oxidative stress in scopolamine-induced amnesia rats.
results_summary: Coadministration of Huperzine A and ligustrazine phosphate significantly reversed scopolamine-induced learning and memory impairment, inhibited acetylcholinesterase activity, increased antioxidant enzyme activities, and reduced lipid peroxidation. The results suggest potential benefits for preventing Alzheimer's disease.
population_specificity: Scopolamine-induced amnesia rats
effective_dosage: Huperzine A (0.14 mg/kg, i.g.) and ligustrazine phosphate (110 mg/kg, i.g.)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to optimize the preparation and characteristics of Huperzine A-loaded nanostructured lipid carriers (NLC) for improved drug delivery in Alzheimer's disease treatment.
results_summary: The study successfully developed Huperzine A-loaded NLC with a mean particle size of 120 nm, high entrapment efficiency (89.18%), and controlled drug release over 96 hours. The formulation showed no recrystallization tendency and demonstrated potential for enhanced drug loading and prolonged release.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro study)
study_duration: Not specified (in vitro release study up to 96 hours)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review newly proposed neuroprotective and anticonvulsant properties of Huperzine A based on animal studies.
results_summary: Huperzine A demonstrated neuroprotective effects by decreasing IL-1β and TNF-α protein expression, suppressing NF-κB signaling, and increasing GABAergic transmission, which was associated with anticonvulsant activity.
population_specificity: Animal studies (specific species not mentioned).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether Huperzine A promotes hippocampal neurogenesis in vitro and in vivo, and its potential therapeutic role in neurological disorders.
results_summary: Huperzine A promoted proliferation of hippocampal neural stem cells in vitro and increased newly generated cells in the hippocampus of adult mice, mediated by the MAPK/ERK pathway. High concentrations reduced cell proliferation, while low concentrations enhanced it.
population_specificity: Mouse embryonic hippocampal neural stem cells (in vitro) and adult mice (in vivo).
effective_dosage: Not specified (low vs. high concentrations mentioned, but exact amounts not provided).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the regenerative effects of hyaluronic acid (HA) with various by-products of human leukocyte platelet-rich fibrin (L-PRF) for interdental papillae reconstruction.
results_summary: HA was less effective than C-PRF in promoting fibroblast proliferation, vascularization, and epithelialization of the papillae. The study found no significant impact of HA on collagen density or interdental papilla height.
population_specificity: Sprague-Dawley rats with a modified open gingival embrasure (OGE) model.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the safety, efficacy, and aesthetic outcomes of a non-surgical rhinoplasty algorithm using hyaluronic acid fillers for nasal profile correction.
results_summary: The study found that the 4-anatomic-point treatment algorithm significantly improved nasal profile and facial harmony, with high patient satisfaction and low morbidity. No major complications were reported, supporting its safety and effectiveness as a minimally invasive alternative to surgical rhinoplasty.
population_specificity: Patients undergoing primary or revision rhinoplasty.

study_goal: To compare the efficacy of two HA-based dermal fillers (CPM-HA20 and CPM-HA20G) in minimizing enlarged facial pores and improving skin quality.
results_summary: Both CPM-HA20 and CPM-HA20G reduced pore volume and improved skin hydration, with CPM-HA20G showing a 24.2% greater reduction in pore volume. Adverse events were mild and tolerable.
population_specificity: Thirty subjects with enlarged facial pores.
effective_dosage: 1 mL per side for 3 sessions spaced 4 weeks apart.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop a hyaluronic acid (HA)-tethered liposomal delivery system for doxorubicin (DOX) and evaluate its effectiveness in targeting breast cancer cells.
results_summary: The HA-tethered liposomal formulation (HA-DOX-TPGS-LIPO) showed sustained drug release, higher cytotoxicity, increased cellular uptake, and greater ROS generation in breast cancer cells compared to free DOX or non-HA liposomal formulations. It also minimized NF-κB protein expression, suggesting enhanced apoptosis.
population_specificity: MDA-MB-231 and MCF-7 breast cancer cell lines (in vitro study).
study_duration: 72 hours (release kinetics); cellular assays duration not specified.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether hyaluronic acid-based nanomotors (HA-NMs) could effectively bypass biological barriers and enhance antibiotic delivery against bacterial infections.
results_summary: HA-NMs loaded with chloramphenicol demonstrated superior antimicrobial activity against E. coli compared to reference nanomotors and effectively penetrated mucin barriers, reducing bacterial proliferation significantly more than free antibiotic.
population_specificity: In vitro model (E. coli and mucin barriers)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess hyaluronic acid as a biomarker for hepatic fibrosis in patients with chronic hepatitis B.
results_summary: Hyaluronic acid levels were significantly higher in participants with hepatic fibrosis and showed a strong positive correlation with fibrosis severity. It demonstrated good sensitivity (81.6%) and specificity (85.5%) for detecting moderate to severe fibrosis, with an AUC of 0.930.
population_specificity: 100 participants with HBV-induced chronic liver disease.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of hyaluronic acid (HA) as an adjunct to scaling and root planing (SRP) in improving clinical outcomes for periodontitis management.
results_summary: HA supplementation showed moderate improvements in clinical parameters like probing depth, clinical attachment level, bleeding on probing, gingival index, and plaque index compared to SRP alone, though heterogeneity in HA concentrations and application methods limited definitive conclusions.
population_specificity: Patients with periodontitis.
effective_dosage: HA concentrations ranged from 0.2% to 1.4%, but specific dosage and frequency were not detailed.
study_duration: Follow-up durations varied from 1 week to 12 months.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify safety considerations and improve injection techniques for hyaluronic acid fillers in the facial upper third (forehead and temporal region).
results_summary: The study found variations in injection techniques and sites for hyaluronic acid fillers in the facial upper third, highlighting the lack of standardized approaches and the need for further investigation to enhance safety and efficacy.
population_specificity: Individuals receiving hyaluronic acid filler injections in the facial upper third (forehead and temporal region).

study_goal: To investigate whether combining intra-articular hyaluronic acid injections with occlusal splint therapy improves treatment outcomes for non-reducible anterior disc displacement of the temporomandibular joint (ADDWoR).
results_summary: The combination therapy significantly improved clinical efficacy, pain reduction, mandibular function, and aesthetic recovery compared to occlusal splint therapy alone, with no increase in adverse reactions.
population_specificity: 62 patients with ADDWoR.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy of hyaluronic acid (HA) injections, acupotomy subcision (AS), and their combination in reducing horizontal neck wrinkles and improving skin rejuvenation.
results_summary: All treatment groups showed improvements in wrinkle reduction and skin rejuvenation, with the combined AS+HA group demonstrating significantly better results in skin elasticity, collagen levels, and participant satisfaction at the 6-month follow-up.
population_specificity: 30 female participants with neck Allergan Transverse Neck Lines Scale (ATNLS) scores of 3-4.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to document a rare adverse effect (granulomatous osteitis) caused by intra-articular hyaluronic acid injections in a patient with severe knee osteoarthritis.
results_summary: The study reported a case of granulomatous osteitis in the proximal tibial epiphysis following hyaluronic acid injection, with microscopic evidence of a gel-like substance and giant cell reaction. No efficacy outcomes for hyaluronic acid were assessed.
population_specificity: A single patient with severe knee osteoarthritis.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the antimicrobial efficacy and tolerability of a novel ophthalmic solution containing cross-linked hyaluronic acid in combination with PHMB for preoperative prophylaxis and infection control.
results_summary: The solution demonstrated fungistatic effects against certain fungi and significant bactericidal activity, particularly against P. aeruginosa and E. coli, while also reducing conjunctival bacterial load in vivo. The combination with hyaluronic acid enhanced tolerability and extended antimicrobial action.
population_specificity: 43 patients undergoing cataract surgery.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the biological mechanisms of intra-articular hyaluronic acid (IAHA) in osteoarthritis (OA) management, including its effects on synovial fluid, inflammation, cartilage preservation, oxidative stress, and pain pathways.
results_summary: IAHA improves synovial fluid lubrication, reduces proinflammatory cytokines, inhibits matrix metalloproteinases, scavenges reactive oxygen species, and modulates pain pathways. High-molecular-weight IAHA is more effective in advanced OA, while low-molecular-weight formulations may benefit early-stage disease.
population_specificity: Patients with osteoarthritis (OA).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the safety, efficacy, and optimal techniques for breast augmentation using Hyaluronic Acid (HA) fillers in young female patients.
results_summary: The study demonstrated that HA fillers were effective in achieving natural breast enhancement with high patient satisfaction and minimal complications. Ultrasound-guided techniques improved accuracy and reduced risks like vascular occlusion and filler migration.
population_specificity: Young female patients seeking breast augmentation.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of using an interdental brush dipped in 0.2% hyaluronic acid (HA) gel on clinical periodontal parameters in patients with periodontitis.
results_summary: The study found that using an interdental brush dipped in 0.2% HA significantly reduced gingival bleeding (PBI) compared to a regular interdental brush at 1 and 3 months, though other periodontal parameters (PI, PD, GI, CAL) showed no significant difference between groups. Both methods improved clinical outcomes compared to baseline.
population_specificity: 60 patients with stages II/III grades A/B periodontitis.
effective_dosage: 0.2% HA gel applied via interdental brush (frequency not specified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize the role of hyaluronic acid in skin aging and wound healing, and explore its latest applications in anti-aging and wound treatment.
results_summary: Hyaluronic acid maintains skin hydration, elasticity, and firmness, and its decline with age leads to drier, less elastic skin and wrinkles. It also plays a key role in wound healing, with applications in anti-aging formulations, nutricosmetics, microneedles, nanoparticles, fillers, and wound dressings.
population_specificity: Not specified (general discussion of HA's role in skin and wound healing).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop a hyaluronic acid double network hydrogel (DNH) to improve wound healing by addressing the limitations of existing hydrogel dressings, such as slow gelation time, weak mechanical performance, and fast degradation.
results_summary: The DNH demonstrated a short gelation time (25 s), strong mechanical properties (Young's modulus = 82 kPa), and maintained structural integrity after swelling. In vivo tests showed faster wound healing, enhanced blood vessel formation, and improved macrophage polarization compared to gauze-treated wounds.
population_specificity: Full-thickness wound models (in vivo study, specific population not detailed).

study_goal: To compare the efficacy of hyaluronic acid (HA) and platelet-rich plasma (PRP) against corticosteroid injections for pain relief and range of motion improvement in patients with adhesive capsulitis.
results_summary: HA demonstrated significant long-term efficacy in pain reduction and functional improvement at 6 months, with better outcomes compared to corticosteroids in some measures, though substantial heterogeneity was noted.
population_specificity: Adult patients with adhesive capsulitis (frozen shoulder).
study_duration: Follow-up periods ranged up to 6 months.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of hyaluronic acid-coated COF loaded with doxorubicin (HA@DOX-COF) in inducing pyroptosis and enhancing antitumor immunity in triple-negative breast cancer (TNBC).
results_summary: HA@DOX-COF activated pyroptosis via the caspase-3/GSDME pathway, induced an antitumor immune response, and improved the efficacy of immune checkpoint blockade (ICB) in a TNBC murine model. The combination of HA@DOX-COF and anti-PD-1 antibody significantly inhibited tumor progression.
population_specificity: Triple-negative breast cancer (TNBC) murine model.

study_goal: To evaluate the efficacy and safety of a single injection session of cross-linked hyaluronic acid gel for vulvovaginal atrophy compared to placebo.
results_summary: The study found that hyaluronic acid significantly reduced the severity of the most bothersome symptom, dryness, and dyspareunia, and improved sexual function scores compared to placebo at 12 weeks. No significant differences were observed in itching/irritation, pain, or vaginal pH between groups, and the treatment was well tolerated.
population_specificity: Postmenopausal women with vulvovaginal atrophy.
effective_dosage: Single injection session (specific dosage not detailed in abstract).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the clinical efficacy and safety of botulinum toxin A combined with hyaluronic acid in improving facial pore enlargement in acne patients.
results_summary: The combination treatment significantly improved facial pore enlargement one month post-treatment, with sustained effects observed at four months compared to baseline. Both physician assessments and patient satisfaction indicated positive outcomes.
population_specificity: 40 acne patients with enlarged pores.
effective_dosage: Not specified (non-cross-linked hyaluronic acid compound injected via mesotherapy with nine 32-gauge microneedles).
study_duration: Follow-up assessments at one and four months post-treatment.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of a hyaluronic acid-based adhesive hydrogel (HCM patch) in promoting muscle regeneration in volumetric muscle loss (VML).
results_summary: The HCM patch hydrogel effectively stimulated satellite cells and supported muscle regeneration with functional restoration in animal models of VML, demonstrating stable physical support and muscle tissue-specific biochemical cues.
population_specificity: Animal models (specific species not mentioned) with volumetric muscle loss.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop a biocompatible, stimuli-responsive imaging and therapeutic delivery system using hyaluronic acid-based polymersomes for enhanced MRI contrast and controlled release in pathological environments.
results_summary: The study found that hyaluronic acid-based polymersomes exhibited enhanced T2-weighted MRI contrast (3-fold higher relaxivity than existing agents) and demonstrated acid- and enzyme-triggered degradation, enabling controlled release and measurable contrast changes in pathological environments. Preliminary in vivo and postmortem studies confirmed strong imaging performance, high biocompatibility, and targeted response to enzymatic, acidic microenvironments.
population_specificity: Not specified (preliminary in vivo and postmortem studies).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy of hyaluronic acid (HA) conjugated with doxorubicin (DOX) and gemcitabine (GEM) for immunomodulation and tumor growth control in glioblastoma (GBM).
results_summary: HA-DOX and HA-GEM conjugates demonstrated synergistic cytotoxic effects, maintained immunogenic cell death properties, and reverted the immunosuppressive tumor microenvironment in GBM models, leading to controlled tumor growth and increased survival in mice.
population_specificity: Orthotopic GL261 and SB28-GBM tumor-bearing mice.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy of acellular hyaluronic acid matrix scaffold, combined with BMAC and autologous bone graft, in treating osteochondral lesions of the talus (OLTs) by assessing biomechanical support and microenvironment optimization.
results_summary: Postoperative outcomes significantly improved, with higher FAOS and SF-36 scores and reduced VAS scores. Early full weight-bearing mobilization (4th week) and lower BMI were associated with better clinical and MRI outcomes at 24 months.
population_specificity: 80 patients (81 ankles) with osteochondral lesions of the talus (OLTs), excluding those with prior ankle surgery, lateral instability surgery, malignancy, or metabolic bone disease.
study_duration: Minimum follow-up of two years postoperatively.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of hyaluronic acid-modified single-walled carbon nanotubes (HA-SWCNTs) for targeted delivery of 17-Hydroxy-jolkinolide B (HJB) to enhance tumor targeting and therapeutic efficacy in breast cancer.
results_summary: HA-SWCNTs-HJB showed improved tumor targeting and cytotoxicity against 4 T1 cells, with a 4.23-fold increase in cellular uptake compared to passive targeting. In vivo, it enhanced tumor accumulation, inhibited tumor growth, and suppressed metastasis without noticeable side effects.
population_specificity: 4 T1 breast cancer-bearing mice.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of hyaluronic acid-coated nanomicelles for targeted delivery of capecitabine to improve permeability and reduce systemic toxicity in breast cancer therapy.
results_summary: The study found that HA-CAP-M significantly improved permeability and cytotoxicity compared to free CAP, demonstrated dose-dependent apoptosis in MCF-7 cells, and showed good stability and controlled drug release.
population_specificity: MCF-7 breast cancer cells (in vitro study).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the molecular mechanisms by which selenide-modified hyaluronic acid hydrogel (Se-HA gel) promotes scleral remodeling during the recovery phase of form-deprivation myopia (FDM).
results_summary: The study found that Se-HA gel significantly promoted fibroblast proliferation, inhibited apoptosis, and prevented transdifferentiation at 250 μg/mL, while a 200 mg/kg subtenon injection improved ocular biometric parameters in FDM mice. It also downregulated HIF-1α expression and regulated inflammation-related genes, with HIF-1α overexpression reversing these effects.
population_specificity: Form-deprivation myopia (FDM) mouse model
effective_dosage: 250 μg/mL in vitro, 200 mg/kg subtenon injection in vivo

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop a hyaluronic acid (HA)-encapsulated nanocomposite (HMP) for synergistic tumor treatment via chemodynamic therapy (CDT), photothermal therapy (PTT), and immunotherapy.
results_summary: The HMP nanocomposites demonstrated enhanced photothermal conversion efficiency (35.46%), GSH depletion, and Mn2+-mediated hydroxyl radical generation for CDT. They also stimulated immune responses (HMGB-1 release, CRT protein generation) and effectively inhibited tumor growth in mice.
population_specificity: BALB/c tumor-bearing mice (in vivo) and 4T1 cells (in vitro).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop a hyaluronic acid-based nanoplatform (HCCD) for combined chemotherapy and photodynamic therapy to enhance tumor targeting and treatment efficacy.
results_summary: The HCCD nanoplatform demonstrated significant tumor size reduction (11-fold compared to control) and activated systemic immune response, suppressing distant tumor growth. The approach showed precise tumor localization and synergistic enhancement of anti-tumor efficacy.
population_specificity: Tumor cells (in vitro and in vivo models)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether combining monopolar radiofrequency (RF) and targeted ultrasound (TUS) promotes facial rejuvenation by increasing hyaluronic acid (HA) production in human skin.
results_summary: The combination of RF + TUS significantly increased HA-stained area by 48.65% at 1 month and 67.69% at 3 months, with visible improvements in skin tightness and rhytid reduction. Stand-alone RF showed minimal HA increase (6.76-9.56%), and the control group exhibited no changes.
population_specificity: Seven subjects aged 51-64 years with BMI 21.1-29.8 kg/m².

study_goal: The researchers aimed to raise awareness about late complications associated with HA filler injections and highlight proper management strategies.
results_summary: Delayed complications to HA fillers include erythema, edema, inflammation, nodules, and infections, presenting weeks to months post-injection. Ultrasound imaging aids in diagnosis and management, with treatments like hyaluronidase and corticosteroid injections being effective.
population_specificity: Patients experiencing delayed reactions to HA fillers (case series of three patients).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy of hyaluronic acid (HA) with irisin (IR) and platelet-rich plasma (PRP) in accelerating fracture healing in rats.
results_summary: HA showed some improvement in bone volume and fracture healing but was statistically less effective than IR and comparable to PRP. By Week 4, IR significantly outperformed HA in bone volume and maximum strength.
population_specificity: Male Wistar albino rats with closed femoral fractures.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop a hyaluronic acid-modified nanocatalyst (HPPCQ) to regulate macrophage polarization and autophagy levels for sustained rheumatoid arthritis remission.
results_summary: HPPCQ demonstrated efficient ROS scavenging, promoted M1-to-M2 macrophage repolarization, and protected M2 macrophages from ferroptosis, significantly reducing clinical scores and inflammation in a mouse model of arthritis.
population_specificity: Collagen-induced arthritis (CIA) mouse model.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of a microneedle-dosage form of hyaluronic acid (cAT-MN) in treating corneal stroma disorders in dry eye disease (DED), particularly in cases where conventional artificial tears (cAT) showed limited efficacy.
results_summary: The study found that cAT-MN with one treatment was significantly more effective than cAT (administered 4 times/day) in reducing corneal stroma scarring and alleviating DED symptoms during the first 5 days of benzalkonium chloride (BAC) exposure. A higher concentration of HA (6%) in the microneedle form restored corneal damage to healthy levels by enhancing HA delivery and permeation.
population_specificity: Subjects with benzalkonium chloride (BAC)-induced corneal stroma scarring and dry eye disease (DED) symptoms.
effective_dosage: 0.1% HA in cAT (4 times/day); HA(6%)-MN (single treatment).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of hyaluronic acid-based hydrogel microspheres loaded with zinc oxide nanoparticles for treating infectious bone defects by assessing antibacterial activity and osteogenic potential.
results_summary: The hydrogel microspheres demonstrated significant antibacterial activity against *Staphylococcus aureus*, enhanced release of antimicrobial peptides in acidic conditions, and promoted osteogenic differentiation of bone marrow stromal cells. In vivo tests showed bone regeneration, improved angiogenesis, and anti-inflammatory effects in a rat skull defect model.
population_specificity: Rat model (skull defect) and in vitro bone marrow stromal cells.
effective_dosage: 6 wt% HAD, 3 wt% AOHA, 1% BOHA, 0.5% photoinitiator, 0.05% ZnO-NPs.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to quantitatively evaluate the efficacy of hyaluronic acid (HA) for osteoarthritis (OA) and identify patient subgroups that would benefit most from HA treatment.
results_summary: The study found that HA interventions were statistically more effective than placebo, with the best efficacy observed when HA was combined with corticosteroids or platelet-rich plasma. Younger, overweight knee OA patients with more severe baseline symptoms and lower KL grade benefited the most.
population_specificity: 24,101 participants with symptomatic or radiographic osteoarthritis.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop and evaluate a radiopaque hyaluronic acid hydrogel for monitoring retention and therapeutic efficacy in treating osteoarthritis.
results_summary: The study found that the iodine-labeled HA hydrogel enabled long-term tracking in mouse knees and attenuated OA progression, with HA-I disappearance rate predicting treatment response. The hydrogel's properties allowed personalized treatment based on retention and therapeutic effect.
population_specificity: Mouse model of osteoarthritis

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether a hyaluronic acid-based microneedle system could effectively deliver Platycladus orientalis leaf extract into the dermis to promote hair growth in androgenic alopecia.
results_summary: The study found that the hyaluronic acid microneedles successfully delivered the extract into the dermis, improved the hair follicle cell proliferation environment by reducing oxidative stress, and activated the Wnt/β-catenin pathway to promote hair growth.
population_specificity: Individuals with androgenic alopecia (specific demographics not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the regenerative effects of hyaluronic acid (HA) alone and in combination with Wharton's jelly-derived MSCs and exosomes for cartilage repair in a rat model.
results_summary: The study found that HA alone did not significantly enhance cartilage repair compared to MSCs or exosomes, and combining HA with MSCs or exosomes showed no additional benefit. Cartilage repair was most effective with MSCs or exosomes alone.
population_specificity: Adult rats with full-thickness cartilage defects in the trochlear grooves of both distal femurs.
effective_dosage: Not specified (three intra-articular injections at weekly intervals).
study_duration: 6 weeks (2 weeks post-surgery + 3 weekly injections + 4 weeks post-final injection).

study_goal: To determine if vaginal cleansing with povidone-iodine before cesarean delivery reduces the risk of maternal infectious morbidities, such as endometritis and wound complications.
results_summary: Vaginal preparation with povidone-iodine significantly reduced post-cesarean endometritis, particularly in women with ruptured membranes, with no reported adverse effects.
population_specificity: Women undergoing cesarean delivery (1946 participants, 1766 analyzed).
effective_dosage: Not specified (povidone-iodine solution used for vaginal cleansing).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to analyze the effect of radioactive iodine (RAI) treatment on survival in medullary thyroid carcinoma (MTC) patients.
results_summary: The study found no significant effects of RAI treatment on disease-free survival (DFS) or disease-specific survival (DSS) in MTC patients. The authors concluded that RAI has no place in the treatment of MTC.
population_specificity: 293 MTC patients without distant metastases who underwent total thyroidectomy between 1980 and 2007 in eight Dutch University Medical Centers.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effect of iodine-impregnated adhesive drapes on surgical site infection rates compared to no drapes.
results_summary: The study found no significant effect of iodine-impregnated adhesive drapes on surgical site infection rates (RR 1.03, 95% CI 0.06 to 1.66, P = 0.89). Length of hospital stay was similar between groups.
population_specificity: Patients undergoing any type of surgery.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the use of iodized salt in the food industry globally and analyze its market context in Bangladesh and Pakistan to improve national universal salt iodization (USI) programs.
results_summary: The study found that iodized salt use in the food industry has shown impact in industrialized countries, and processed foods containing salt are increasingly available in rural Bangladesh and Pakistan. However, the actual impact on iodine intake remains unquantified, and further data are needed.
population_specificity: Rural populations in Bangladesh and Pakistan, with a focus on bakers, food wholesalers, retailers, and processed food consumers.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of adjuvant iodine-125 brachytherapy on postoperative recurrence and overall survival in hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC) patients after curative resection.
results_summary: The study found that iodine-125 brachytherapy significantly prolonged time to recurrence (60.0 vs. 36.7 months in controls) and improved 1-, 3-, and 5-year overall survival rates compared to the control group, with manageable adverse events.
population_specificity: 68 HCC patients who underwent curative hepatectomy.
effective_dosage: Not specified (iodine-125 seed implantation on resection surface).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the surgical completeness and safety of bilateral axillo-breast approach (BABA) robotic thyroidectomy (RoT) for thyroid diseases.
results_summary: The study found that BABA RoT is safe and effective, with low rates of postoperative complications (e.g., transient hypoparathyroidism in 39.1%, transient vocal cord palsy in 14.2%) and recurrence, and good surgical completeness indicated by low thyroglobulin levels.
population_specificity: Patients undergoing BABA robotic thyroidectomy (1026 cases, 968 malignant tumors, 58 benign thyroid diseases).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the feasibility and outcomes of two radioguided localization techniques (ROLL-(99m)Tc and (125)I seed) for breast-conserving surgery after neoadjuvant systemic treatment.
results_summary: Both techniques showed comparable results in terms of resected specimen weight, margin status, and need for additional surgery, with no significant differences. The study concluded that (125)I seed localization simplifies surgery scheduling and is preferred for breast-conserving surgery post-neoadjuvant treatment.
population_specificity: Patients with nonpalpable breast tumors treated with neoadjuvant systemic therapy (n=154: 83 for ROLL-(99m)Tc, 71 for (125)I seed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of a bovine pericardial matrix (BPM) in preventing Frey's syndrome after parotidectomy compared to the superficial musculoaponeurotic system (SMAS) flap.
results_summary: The study found that BPM was more effective than SMAS flap in preventing Frey's syndrome, with 0% of BPM patients testing positive via Minor's test compared to 10% in the SMAS group. Subjective symptoms were also lower in the BPM group (5%) versus the SMAS group (10%).
population_specificity: 40 patients with benign parotid gland tumors (30 pleomorphic adenoma, 7 Warthin tumor, 3 basal cell adenoma).

study_goal: To evaluate the clinical utility of dual energy spectral CT (DEsCT) in staging and characterizing gastric cancers, particularly using iodine concentration measurements.
results_summary: The study found that monochromatic images from DEsCT improved N-staging accuracy, and normalized iodine concentration (nIC) values helped differentiate between differentiated and undifferentiated gastric carcinomas and between metastatic and non-metastatic lymph nodes.
population_specificity: 96 patients suspected of gastric cancers.

study_goal: The researchers reviewed the potential of gadolinium oxide nanoparticles as multimodal imaging agents, drug carriers, and therapeutic agents, comparing their efficacy to commercial iodine compounds.
results_summary: The study found that gadolinium oxide nanoparticles are superior to iodine compounds as CT and ultrasound imaging contrast agents and thermal neutron capture therapeutic agents, with potential for enhanced diagnosis and therapy when conjugated with targeting agents.
population_specificity: Not specified (review of nanoparticle applications).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the contribution of preablation Iodine 131 scans with SPECT/CT to the staging of differentiated thyroid cancer.
results_summary: The study found that preablation scans detected regional metastases in 35% of patients and distant metastases in 8%, changing staging in 4% of younger and 25% of older patients. These findings suggest that preablation scans significantly contribute to accurate thyroid cancer staging.
population_specificity: 320 post-total thyroidectomy patients (138 aged <45 years, 182 aged ≥45 years), including subgroups with T1a and T1b tumors.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether dual-energy CT (DECT) iodine quantification could better predict therapeutic response and survival in advanced GIST patients treated with tyrosine-kinase inhibitors compared to established criteria.
results_summary: DECT criteria showed significantly longer progression-free survival for responders (9-29 months vs. 2-6 months for non-responders) and was the only method to predict overall survival at 6 months. The absence of progression was the most predictive biomarker, regardless of criteria.
population_specificity: Seventeen patients with advanced gastrointestinal stromal tumors (GIST) treated with tyrosine-kinase inhibitors.
study_duration: Assessments at 2 and 6 months after treatment initiation.
